gui

Class HotSpot

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.HotSpot

  • public class HotSpot
extends java.lang.Object
    HotSpot defines a rectangular area centered at a specified location on the screen. Given a location (x,y), HotSpot determines whether that location is within the rectangular area.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HotSpot(int hot_id, int x, int y, int w, int h)
      The centered location (x,y) and dimensions (w,h) of the HotSpot are passed to the constructor.

      boolean isSelected(int x_click, int y_click)
      Returns whether the provided (x,y) is within the hot spot area.

      void setHotY(int y)
